接口 CardGameTable

  • 所有已知实现类:
    BigTwoTable

    public interface CardGameTable
    An interface for a general card game table (GUI)
    作者:
    Kenneth Wong

    • 方法概要

      所有方法 实例方法 抽象方法 
      限定符和类型 方法和说明
      void clearMsgArea()
      Clears the message area of the card game table.
      void disable()
      Disables user interactions.
      void enable()
      Enables user interactions.
      int[] getSelected()
      Returns an array of indices of the cards selected.
      void printMsg(java.lang.String msg)
      Prints the specified string to the message area of the card game table.
      void repaint()
      Repaints the GUI.
      void reset()
      Resets the GUI.
      void resetSelected()
      Resets the list of selected cards to an empty list.
      void setActivePlayer(int activePlayer)
      Sets the index of the active player (i.e., the current player).

    • 方法详细资料

      • setActivePlayer

        void setActivePlayer(int activePlayer)
        Sets the index of the active player (i.e., the current player).
        参数:
        activePlayer - an int value representing the index of the active player

      • getSelected

        int[] getSelected()
        Returns an array of indices of the cards selected.
        返回:
        an array of indices of the cards selected

      • resetSelected

        void resetSelected()
        Resets the list of selected cards to an empty list.

      • repaint

        void repaint()
        Repaints the GUI.

      • printMsg

        void printMsg(java.lang.String msg)
        Prints the specified string to the message area of the card game table.
        参数:
        msg - the string to be printed to the message area of the card game table

      • clearMsgArea

        void clearMsgArea()
        Clears the message area of the card game table.

      • reset

        void reset()
        Resets the GUI.

      • enable

        void enable()
        Enables user interactions.

      • disable

        void disable()
        Disables user interactions.
